abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; overall
            Bank performance is satisfactory; and overall Borrower
            performance is satisfactory. The project's success was
            attributed to the following: 1) Careful selection of the
            team members of the implementation unit team (PIU) and
            insisting on keeping the team as compact as possible with no
            changes in the team during the entire project period. 2)
            Arrangements for adequate training of the PIU team
            immediately after the project's approval and before the
            real start of the project. 3) The members of the
            implementation unit team should be released from any other
            obligations at the company, allowing them to devote their
            time fully to the projects tasks and their successful
            implementation. 4) At the beginning of the project, the PIU
            team should be fully organized and equipped with all
            necessary technical goods, such as adequate office space,
            phones, fax and copy machines, printers, cameras, car, and a
            stable, fast Internet connection, etc. 5) The contacts
            between PIU members and Contractors should be as frequent as
            possible, if not daily. 6) The contacts between PIU members
            and the Bank Team Leader or his representative should be
            more frequent then regular Bank's missions. This could
            improve the overall project performance and support all
            necessary discussions about all pending issues on the
            project and its implementation. 7) This project reinforces
            the lesson that worthwhile projects take considerable time
            to complete and rushing them greatly increases the chances
            of failure. This project took 7 years from start to
            completion -- as planned. If it had been a five year project
            it would have had to be extended or would not have been
            anywhere near as successful.
